notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning. Leaves missing after folio 22. A number of pages stained or damaged.
3 folded leaves at the end of the volume, of a recent date, in an Ashkenazi cursive script, with notes on Talmudical portions beginning on folio 143v of the same manuscript.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Volume 1 of a portion of the Palestinian Talmud, with a commentary by Solomon ben Joseph Sirillo.

supportDesc.extent: 371 folios (+ 2 modern paper flyleaves at the beginning and at the end).

collation.p: Original quiring not established. All levaes stuck on paper (modern restoration).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square and semi-cursive script of the 16th century, partially an autograph of the commentator.

binding.p: Post-1600. Black leather. Spine title: Talmud Jerushalmi. Hebrew. Vol. I. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2822.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: J. J. Leep (al. Bril): purchased from him by the British Museum on 17 January 1885: inscribed, folio .
